name: pancreatic and duodenal homeobox 1
other_names: insulin promoter factor 1, homeodomain transcription factor

kegg.name: Type II diabetes mellitus - Homo sapiens (human)
Maturity onset diabetes of the young - Homo sapiens (human)

pid.name: FOXA2 and FOXA3 transcription factor networks

reactome.name: Regulation of gene expression in beta cells
Regulation of gene expression in early pancreatic precursor cells

summary: The protein encoded by this gene is a transcriptional activator of several genes, including insulin, somatostatin, glucokinase, islet amyloid polypeptide, and glucose transporter type 2. The encoded nuclear protein is involved in the early development of the pancreas and plays a major role in glucose-dependent regulation of insulin gene expression. Defects in this gene are a cause of pancreatic agenesis, which can lead to early-onset insulin-dependent diabetes mellitus (IDDM), as well as maturity onset diabetes of the young type 4 (MODY4). [provided by RefSeq, Aug 2017].
